titleStmt.title: The case of the governour and garrison of Londonderry, when it was beseiged by the Irish army, 1688. and such of them as were afterwards added by His Majesties most gracious warrants, as supernumerary or reformed officers, and served as such during the war of Ireland. Humbly submitted to the honourable the Commons of England, in Parliament assembled.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
